description: From Latin abiugātus, perfect passive participle of abiugō (“remove, separate from”); from ab- (“away from”) + iugō (“bind, connect”).

verbs.description: abjugate (third-person singular simple present abjugates, present participle abjugating, simple past and past participle abjugated)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, transitive) To unyoke; set free; uncouple.
